posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi ECB'ers

This was an interesting build I cooked up.

Dual Kukri , ITWF (for up to 7 APR with haste), WF/EWF, WS/EWS, +6AB from WM with its lovely crit range bonus, Dev Crit, Blind Fight, Knockdown, Evasion, Uncanny Dodge, 2d6 sneak attack, 450+ hp, 230 odd skill points for UMD Tumble 40 max discipline etc...

Base AB 50, Base AB 48 with dual Kukri. 

Against Crit and Sneak immunes, Str 30 + WS/EWS -> + 16 damage per hit on main hand, + 11 damage per hit off hand. without any buffs. with 6-7 APR

Rough work packing everything possible into this build

Weaknesses - definitely the saves. Also its a human, so minus points for creativity there. 

I tried out Halfling and Dwarven variants but they didn't end up as strong, this build needs as many feats as humanly possible. If you drop Dev Crit those variants are almost certainly more powerful. I definitely have a soft spot for halflings, they are super cute.

Used a sneaky trick, taking Fighter 11 / WM 9 pre-epic for BAB 30. Then take one fighter level epic to get whatever bonus feat I wanted. 

Anyway I've posted it here for recording sake, also to see if there was any other suggestions RE optimising.

Similar ITWF Kukri builds:
- Mick Dagger's updated Kukri Master 
- Mick Dagger's Kukri Saint - Fighter / CoT / WM

Other ITWF WM builds:
- Halfling dagger master and Revised Halfling dagger master, great AB, dev crit but no blind fight or knockdown
